function.name: ask_followup_question
function.description: Ask the user a question to gather additional information needed to complete the task. Use when clarification or more detail is required before proceeding.

question.description: Clear, specific question that captures the missing information you need

follow_up.description: Optional list of 2-4 suggested responses; each suggestion must be a complete, actionable answer and may include a mode switch

text.description: Suggested answer the user can pick

mode.description: Optional mode slug to switch to if this suggestion is chosen (e.g., code, architect)

function.name: attempt_completion
function.description: After each tool use, the user will respond with the result of that tool use, i.e. if it succeeded or failed, along with any reasons for failure. Once you've received the results of tool uses and can confirm that the task is complete, use this tool to present the result of your work to the user. The user may respond with feedback if they are not satisfied with the result, which you can use to make improvements and try again. IMPORTANT NOTE: This tool CANNOT be used until you've confirmed from the user that any previous tool uses were successful. Failure to do so will result in code corruption and system failure. Before using this tool, you must confirm that you've received successful results from the user for any previous tool uses. If not, then DO NOT use this tool.

result.description: Final result message to deliver to the user once the task is complete

function.name: browser_action
function.description: Interact with a Puppeteer-controlled browser session. Always start by launching at a URL and always finish by closing the browser. While the browser is active, do not call any other tools. Use coordinates within the viewport to hover or click, provide text for typing, and ensure actions are grounded in the latest screenshot and console logs.

url.description: URL to open when performing the launch action; must include protocol

coordinate.description: Screen coordinate for hover or click actions; target the center of the desired element

x.description: Horizontal pixel position within the current viewport

y.description: Vertical pixel position within the current viewport

size.description: Viewport dimensions to apply when performing the resize action

text.description: Text to type when performing the type action

function.name: codebase_search
function.description: Run a semantic search across the workspace to find files relevant to a natural-language query. Reuse the user's wording where possible and keep queries in English.

query.description: Meaning-based search query describing the information you need

path.description: Optional subdirectory (relative to the workspace) to limit the search scope

function.name: edit_file
function.description: Use this tool to make an edit to a file. A less intelligent apply model will read your request, so be clear about the change while minimizing unchanged code. Specify each edit sequentially and replace omitted sections with // ... existing code ... placeholders. Provide enough surrounding context to avoid ambiguity, always use the placeholder when skipping existing content, show before-and-after context when deleting, and gather all edits for the file in a single request.

target_file.description: Full path of the file to modify

instructions.description: Single first-person sentence summarizing the edit to guide the apply model

code_edit.description: Only the edited lines using // ... existing code ... wherever unchanged content is omitted

function.name: execute_command
function.description: Run a CLI command on the user's system. Tailor the command to the environment, explain what it does, and prefer relative paths or shell-appropriate chaining. Use the cwd parameter only when directed to run in a different directory.

cwd.description: Optional working directory for the command, relative or absolute

function.name: fetch_instructions
function.description: Retrieve detailed instructions for performing a predefined task, such as creating an MCP server or creating a mode.

task.description: Task identifier to fetch instructions for

function.name: generate_image
function.description: Create a new image or edit an existing one using OpenRouter image models. Provide a prompt describing the desired output, choose where to save the image in the current workspace, and optionally supply an input image to transform.

prompt.description: Text description of the image to generate or the edits to apply

path.description: Filesystem path (relative to the workspace) where the resulting image should be saved

image.description: Optional path (relative to the workspace) to an existing image to edit; supports PNG, JPG, JPEG, GIF, and WEBP

function.name: insert_content
function.description: Insert new lines into a file without modifying existing content. Choose a line number to insert before, or use 0 to append to the end.

path.description: File path to modify, expressed relative to the workspace

line.description: 1-based line number to insert before, or 0 to append at the end of the file

content.description: Exact text to insert at the chosen location

function.name: list_code_definition_names
function.description: List definition names (classes, functions, methods, etc.) from source files to understand code structure. Works on a single file or across all top-level files in a directory.

path.description: Path to the file or directory to analyze, relative to the workspace

function.name: list_files
function.description: List files and directories within a given directory. Optionally recurse into subdirectories. Do not use this tool to confirm file creation; rely on user confirmation instead.

path.description: Directory path to inspect, relative to the workspace

recursive.description: Set true to list contents recursively; omit or false to show only the top level

function.name: new_task
function.description: Create a new task instance in a specified mode, supplying the initial instructions and optionally a starting todo list when required by settings.

mode.description: Slug of the mode to begin the new task in (e.g., code, debug, architect)

message.description: Initial user instructions or context for the new task

todos.description: Optional initial todo list written as a markdown checklist; required when the workspace mandates todos

function.name: read_file
function.description: Read one or more files and return their contents with line numbers for diffing or discussion. Use line ranges when available to keep reads efficient and combine related files when possible.

files.description: List of files to read; request related files together when allowed

path.description: Path to the file to read, relative to the workspace

line_ranges.description: Optional 1-based inclusive ranges to read (format: start-end). Use multiple ranges for non-contiguous sections and keep ranges tight to the needed context.

function.name: run_slash_command
function.description: Execute a predefined slash command to receive detailed instructions or content for a common task.

command.description: Name of the slash command to run (e.g., init, test, deploy)

args.description: Optional additional context or arguments for the command

function.name: search_and_replace
function.description: Find and replace text within a file using literal strings or regular expressions. Supports optional line ranges, regex mode, and case-insensitive matching, and shows a diff preview before applying changes.

path.description: File path to modify, relative to the workspace

search.description: Text or pattern to search for

replace.description: Replacement text to insert for each match

start_line.description: Optional starting line (1-based) to limit replacements

end_line.description: Optional ending line (1-based) to limit replacements

use_regex.description: Set true to treat the search parameter as a regular expression

ignore_case.description: Set true to ignore case when matching

function.name: search_files
function.description: Run a regex search across files under a directory, returning matches with surrounding context.

path.description: Directory to search recursively, relative to the workspace

regex.description: Rust-compatible regular expression pattern to match

file_pattern.description: Optional glob to limit which files are searched (e.g., *.ts)

function.name: switch_mode
function.description: Request a switch to a different assistant mode. The user must approve the change before it takes effect.

mode_slug.description: Slug of the mode to switch to (e.g., code, ask, architect)

reason.description: Optional explanation for why the mode switch is needed

function.name: update_todo_list
function.description: Replace the entire todo list with an updated single-level markdown checklist that reflects the current plan and status. Always confirm completed work, keep unfinished items, add new actionable tasks, and follow the [ ], [x], [-] status rules.

todos.description: Full markdown checklist in execution order, using [ ] for pending, [x] for completed, and [-] for in progress

function.name: write_to_file
function.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with the exact content provided. Use only when a full rewrite is intended; the tool will create missing directories automatically.

path.description: Path to the file to write, relative to the workspace

content.description: Full contents that the file should contain with no omissions or line numbers

line_count.description: Total number of lines in the written file, counting blank lines
